item.title: Report E-2025040637
item.description:
Report E-2025040637

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-28T03:42:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-31
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from two (2) 1-gallon metal pails in a paper box due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel gathered the pails and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025040651
item.description:
Report E-2025040651

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-15
  • City: RIVERTON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 18000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 09:03 ET, XPO notified the Call Center of a cargo release at terminal XSF. It was reported that an unknown amount of an unknown hazard class 2.3 released from one compressed gas canister due to currently unknown reasons. The release impacted Trailer #3171296 which is located in the yard, close to Dock #38. Contractor stated that there was condensation on the cylinders and some residual product in the cylinders. After speaking with the Shipper, they were informed that the cylinders shipped as empty, but that they do not bleed them empty, so residual is possible. Wally's team found 7 cylinders that weren't closed properly that could have contributed to the hissing that XPO was hearing. The contractor's dragar tubes did provide some detections low in the trailer and those readings will be provided to us, momentarily. They used simple green to clean the trailer floor. A crew member will be returning to the sire to overpack the PAIL of impacted absorbents and the contractor will be billing for the SCBA refills.

item.title: Report E-2025040644
item.description:
Report E-2025040644

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-31
  • City: EAST MOLINE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately 1 gallon of Satin Map Mixing Base paint, and 1.5 gallons of Specialty White paint were released from 2 boxes containing four (4) 1-gallon metal pails due to improper loading. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area. Terminal personnel gathered the spent material, and four (4) pails of product and containerized it into one (1) 30-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025040547
item.description:
Report E-2025040547

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-26
  • City: DES PLAINES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 09:30 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO Logistics (XDP) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately .5 gallon of NQ Solve 1110 (hazardous - UN2059) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product, 2 damaged lids, and oil-dri will be placed into a 55-gallon metal drum. The 2 lids of the damaged drums will be replaced and sealed to move on to the Consignee. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. There is no regulatory reporting required for this release. ERTS will upload the BOL, SDS and create a waste container entry. ERTS contacted Alex (Chemtrec) who provided report #2025032600102.

item.title: Report E-2025040551
item.description:
Report E-2025040551

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-25
  • City: LA SALLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 03:16 on 3/26, XPO-XLA contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 5 gallons of "Sikadur Hex 300" from a 5gal metal pail onto the trailer and dock floors. The pail was crushed against another piece of freight at LTU. ERTS confirmed the product to be a class 8 corrosive and will dispatch a contractor to assist with cleanup. ERTS reported the spill to Chemtrec and spoke to Esta who provided the report number: 2025032500019. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed the entire 1.2-gallon of UN2735 Sikadur Hex 300 released to 4’x8’ area of the wooden trailer floor. The floor was scrubbed with water and the pH strip test was completed showing a pH of 8. The waste was containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 7/22/2025 @1100ct Altom Transport was at our facility to load out solvent and when everything was connected and ready to pump into there tanker the line pressurised and the material did not flow into the tanker. The line broke due to the increased pressure causing approximately 50 gallons of material to be released onto the containment pad. There was no soil or water ways impacted the material was completely contained on the containment pad at the loading area. The immediately called for our internal response team and was able to reclaim and wipe up the material with absorbents that were disposed of properly. The clean up was completed by 1300ct.
